summary:
Hi there, my name is Alexey Popov and I was born in the coldest city of the world - Yakutsk. So far I was blessed with the opportunities that made my life an adventure. I went to university in one of the most beautiful cities in the world - Istanbul, worked across different regions in Russia, spend some time in Scotland, and currently live in the Netherlands. 
These days, I am studying MBA and exploring area of mountaineering, looking forward to collect "7 summits" or more, so far was on top of Montblanc, Kilimanjaro, Elbrus, and trekked to Everest Base Camp.
Professionally , I am Cost and Performance Engineer with experience in Completion and Well Intervention Engineering within Shell. Before Shell I was working on the "other side" of the business - service company (Schlumberger), where I obtained knowledge and skills in Coiled Tubing and Cementing Engineering.  In general, I hold strong professional skills in HSE auditing, Oil & Gas, Coiled tubing, Stimulation, Downhole Tools, Cementing, Slickline, Well Testing, Well Intervention, and Cost and Performance management.
Other areas of interest:
 - Cycling and building custom bikes
 - Tennis, both watching an playing
 - Boxing

profile_positions.title: Wells Engineer - Cost and Performance at Wintershall Noordzee

profile_positions.description:
The main duties of this assignment are assurance of the cost estimates against compliance to Shell cost estimating manual, benchmarking the costs against internal and external performance data, maintaining the “invisible layer” of Time Cost Model (TCM) to ensure that market trends are reflected. Submission of accurate and credible figures, maintaining communication with Asset and Wells central teams were crucial activities during business plan cycle.
Another important part of the responsibilities is performance management through the cadence meetings and Shell internal WEIS Funnel management system which allows tracking of opportunities and downsides for each operation performed in wells department, communication and coordination of those with Shell central planning and performance team.
profile_positions.title: Wells Engineer - Cost and Performance

profile_positions.description: In 2015 I  joined NAM/Shell in the Netherlands as experienced hire for position of Wells Engineer - Completion and Well Interventions. Since then I have held positions: within internal Slickline services provider as a job planner, then have supervised (WSS) various well intervention activities and several well completion operations on both land and offshore, worked as Front End Design Team Engineer  for well intervention  (WRFM) and now I am in a position of operations support engineer (desk engineer operations).
profile_positions.title: Wells Engineer - Completion and Well Intervention

profile_positions.description:
In 2013 I was transferred to Aberdeen, UK, where I was assigned to BP UK office providing in-house engineering services. I was incorporated into BP Rigs team and was responsible for provide technical solutions for cementing casing/liner strings on both platform and subsea wells, also was involved in designing a number of decomissioning / abandonment operations.
During this assignment I introduced new technology that allowed to enhance mud removal and as a consequence improved zonal isolation for intermediate casing strings, the success was confirmed by cement bond logs (SBT-CAST) and the absence of sustained casing pressure which was present on all previously drilled and cemented intermediate casings.
profile_positions.title: DESC Engineer for BP UK (North Sea)

profile_positions.description:
In 2012 when Schlumberger took over cementing scope of work for Exxon from  competition, I was assigned as an Engineer responsible for the project. This was unique project as Exxon is drilling the Record Long Extended Reach wells, the measured depth of the wells were around 12,500 m (41,000 ft) on Land (Yastreb) and Offshore (Orlan) rigs. 
My responsibilities included planning, preparation of programs, lab testing, logistics of materials, management of personnel assigned to the project, building up the trust and relationships with new client in such a challenging project.
profile_positions.title: DESC Engineer for Exxon - Offshore and Land Rigs

profile_positions.description:
In 2011 I was offered an opportunity to cross train to Schlumberger Well Integrity Technology (WIT) segment that is dealing with cementing, abandonments and other isolation techniques including the packers. 
After training and gaining practice on "High Volume" market of land operations I was assigned as Cementing engineer for one of the platforms (Piltun-B) which is operated by Shell (SEIC).
I was responsible for planning, preparation of the cementing programs, lab testing of cement slurries, logistics of cementing materials, equipment for my platform, and was managing the personnel assigned to the platform.
During this assignment I managed to introduce 2 new technologies that helped Shell to resolve the problems with: zonal isolation for intermediate casing, and introduced new solid-free, non-damaging loss circulation fluid for completion operations.
profile_positions.title: Cementing Services Engineer for Shell (SEIC) - Offshore operations

profile_positions.description:
My assignment to Sakhalin location, was more than geographical transfer, it was transfer from "High Volume - Low Technology" market to "High Technology - Low Volume"  market; i.e. from location performing around 70-80 jobs per year to location performing 2-3 jobs per year using the latest technologies available in the market.
During this assignment I was responsible for communication with Shell's completion and well intervention department, production technologists, working on the best possible solutions for challenges that involved Coiled Tubing Operations. The operations included:
- Underbalanced perforating long intervals, up to 650 m (2100 ft), in a single run in big-bore gas wells with 9-5/8" completions, using CIRP technology and "X-11" the latest fully computerized Coiled Tubing Unit.
profile_positions.title: Coiled Tubing Services Engineer for Shell (SEIC) - Offshore operations

profile_positions.description:
After successful start up of location during previous assignment I was transferred to Buzuluk (Volga-Urals Region) where new Schlumberger location for Stimulation and Coiled Tubing Services was at the start-up stage.
As a member of start-up team I was responsible for Coiled Tubing part of the services which included setting up the logistics, the base and relationships with new client company (TNK-BP Orenburg).
I stayed for more than 2 years at the location and was responsible for preparing the programs, managing the equipment and people for Coiled Tubing Services. During the assignment I managed to diversify the portfolio of services provided by Schlumberger Coiled Tubing. At the beginning Coiled Tubing was used only for post hydraulic fracturing cleanouts, later part of our operations included matrix acidizing with occasional milling and fishing operations, these increased the utilization of Coiled Tubing equipment.
profile_positions.title: Coiled Tubing Services Engineer for TNK-BP Orenburg

profile_positions.description:
I was assigned as an engineer to start-up the brand new location for Schlumberger, where Coiled Tubing was provided as a first service, later on other Schlumberger service lines started on that location as a result of superior service provided by Coiled Tubing Services.
My responsibilities included setting up the office in a new town, create and maintain network connections with the new client company (TNK-BP), preparations of Coiled Tubing programs, managing the 1 Coiled Tubing Fleet and logistics.
profile_positions.title: Coiled Tubing Services Engineer for TNK-BP Nyagan

profile_positions.description:
Started in field operations as field engineer trainee (FET), then became a field engineer acting as supervisor for the Coiled Tubing Services. I was supervising the crews of up to 10 people and the fleet of Coiled Tubing equipment consisting of up to 13 vehicles. 
Gradually, I was transferred to the office as coordinator for 3 Coiled Tubing Fleets (30 vehicles and up to 40 people). My responsibilities included preparation of programs for Coiled Tubing operations, maintain relationships with client company (Rosneft-YNG), and managing the logistics for ongoing operations.
profile_positions.title: Coiled Tubing Field Engineer, Field and Office
